obscure adjective
(NOT CLEAR)
not clear and difficult to understand or see: Official policy has changed, for reasons that remain obscure. His answers were obscure and confusing.

to prevent something from being seen or heard: Two new skyscrapers had sprung up, obscuring the view from her window. The sun was obscured by clouds.
Thesaurus: synonyms, antonyms, and examples
to keep someone or something from being seen hideI'll need to hide the sweets so the children don't find them.concealHe did his best to conceal his true feelings from his spouse.secreteThe spies smuggled the films out of the country by secreting them in the lining of their coats.cloakThe proceedings were cloaked in secrecy.
See more results »
to make something difficult to discover and understand: Managers deliberately obscured the real situation from federal investigators.
